items.name: Cook’s Mate Tasks
items.description:
@UUID[Item.y0ytBBFx52vEQkrX]{Hunting and Cooking}
Success: Job is completed.
Failure: Job is failed and results in minor punishment like a verbal reprimand or a rope bash.
Critical Failure: Job is failed and results in severe punishment, like three lashes. The number of lashes increases to six if this is the second such failure in a row, to nine lashes for three failures, increases from there.

results.text: Cooking Assisting: Ambrose Kroop in preparing the day’s meal. If Kroop is sober, no check is required. If Kroop is drunk, this requires a @Check[type:Cooking Lore|dc:11] or Check[type:crafting|dc:13] check.

Fishing: Catching tonight’s supper using the ship’s nets. A  @Check[type:Fishing Lore|dc:11] or @Check[type:survival|dc:13] check provides enough fish. A failed check results in a day in the bilges as punishment the following day.

Turtle Hunting: Hunting leatherback sea turtles with harpoons, treble hooks, and nets. A @Check[type:Fishing Lore|dc:11] or @Check[type:survival|dc:13] check provides enough food. A failed check results in a day in the bilges as punishment the following day.
Bull Session: Drinking with Ambrose Kroop and listening to his stories. The cook’s mate must drink an additional rum ration, but is able to take an additional ship action during the day.

Special Occasion: Captain Harrigan is celebrating something today, and wants one of the ship’s pigs butchered and cooked for dinner. A character must make a @Check[type:Cooking Lore|dc:11] or @Check[type:survival|dc:13] check to slaughter the animal, then help Kroop to clean, cut, and prepare the carcass. If Kroop is drunk, this requires a @Check[type:Cooking Lore|dc:15] or Check[type:crafting|dc:17] check.

items.name: Rigger's Tasks
items.description:
Success: Job is completed.
Failure: Job is failed and results in minor punishment like a verbal reprimand or a rope bash.
Critical Failure: Job is failed and results in severe punishment, like three lashes. The number of lashes increases to six if this is the second such failure in a row, to nine lashes for three failures, increases from there.

results.text: Rigging Repair: The ship’s rigging frequently gets damaged and must be repaired, requiring a @Check[type:athletics|dc:13|traits:action:climb] check to Climb the rigging 30 feet up, followed by a @Check[type:Sailing Lore|dc:11] check or @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:13] check.

Line Work: Hard work hoisting and lowering sails, requiring a @Check[type:Sailing Lore|dc:11] check or @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:13] check. A character must also make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17] saving throw to avoid being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} at the end of the shift.

Upper Rigging Work: Work in the upper rigging, 50 feet up, requiring a @Check[type:athletics|dc:13|traits:action:climb] check to Climb, followed by a @Check[type:Sailing Lore|dc:11] check or @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:13] check.

Rope Work Handling the ship’s ropes, including coiling them, stowing them, and securing them to cleats and single and double bollards, requiring a @Check[type:Sailing Lore|dc:11] check or @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:13] check.
Lookout: A climb to the crow’s nest 60 feet up, requiring a @Check[type:athletics|dc:13|traits:action:climb] check to Climb followed by a @Check[type:perception|dc:13] check.

Mainsail Duties: Tough work raising and lowering the mainsail, requiring a @Check[type:Sailing Lore|dc:11] check or @Check[type:athletics|dc:13] check. A character must also make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17] saving throw to avoid being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} at the end of the shift.

items.name: Swab's Tasks
items.description:
Success: Job is completed.
Failure: Job is failed and results in minor punishment like a verbal reprimand or a rope bash.
Critical Failure: Job is failed and results in severe punishment, like three lashes. The number of lashes increases to six if this is the second such failure in a row, to nine lashes for three failures, increases from there.

results.text: Man the Bilges: Vile and sweaty work cleaning out the bilges, requiring a @Check[type:athletics|dc:17] check. A character must also make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17] saving throw to avoid being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} at the end of the shift.

Rat Catcher: Catching rats and other vermin belowdecks, requiring a @Check[type:stealth|dc:13] or @Check[type:survival|dc:13] check to catch and kill enough rats, cockroaches, and beetles for a good day’s work.

Swab the Decks: Backbreaking work mopping the decks and scrubbing them with sandstone blocks called holystones, requiring a @Check[type:athletics|dc:13] check or @Check[type:fortitude|dc:13] saving throw. Failing the check results in a character being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} at the end of the shift.

Hauling Rope and Knot: Work Tying and untying knots in the ship’s ropes and moving heavy coils of rope from one part of the ship to another, requiring a @Check[type:Sailing Lore|dc:11] check or @Check[type:athletics|dc:13] check. A character must also make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:13] saving throw to avoid being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} at the end of the shift.

Runner: Passing messages to the crew and officers of the Wormwood in all part of the ship except the officers’ cabins,  @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:13] check or @Check[type:fortitude|dc:13] saving throw. Failing the check results in a character being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} at the end of the shift.

Repairs: Things constantly tear or break aboard the ship and need repairs, whether sewing sails or splicing rope all day, requiring a  @Check[type:Sailing Lore|dc:11] check or @Check[type:crafting|dc:13] check.
